pkgmetadata.longdescription: Facilities for Simulating from ODE-Based Models // Facilities for running simulations from ordinary differential equation (ODE) models, such as pharmacometrics and other compartmental models. A compilation manager translates the ODE model into C, compiles it, and dynamically loads the object code into R for improved computational efficiency. An event table object facilitates the specification of complex dosing regimens (optional) and sampling schedules. NB: The use of this package requires both C and Fortran compilers, for details on their use with R please see Section 6.3, Appendix A, and Appendix D in the "R Administration and Installation" manual. Also the code is mostly released under GPL. The VODE and LSODA are in the public domain. The information is available in the inst/COPYRIGHTS. You can also obtain the archived SnakeCharmR for python integration from CRAN archives https://cran.r-project.org/src/contrib/Archive/SnakeCharmR/ or https://github.com/nlmixrdevelopment/SnakeCharmR.
